title: ICE while compiling `tower` for `tonic` on `nightly`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
An ICE occurs when compiling `tower` as dependency for `tonic:0.8.1` using the `rustc nightly` compiler. ### Code `main.rs`: ```Rust fn main() { println!("Hello World"); } ``` `Cargo.toml`: ```toml [package] name = "ice-tower" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" [dependencies] tonic = "=0.8.1" ``` I've created a repository with a `Cargo.lock` file to help reproduce this error: https://github.com/grtlr/rustc-ice-tower-2022-09-15 Please let me know if there is anything that I can do to help solve this. Thank you! ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0-nightly (750bd1a7f 2022-09-14) binary: rustc commit-hash: 750bd1a7ff3e010611b97ee75d30b7cbf5f3a03c commit-date: 2022-09-14 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.65.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` RUST_BACKTRACE=full cargo +nightly build (main|✔) ~/D/ICE-tower Compiling tower v0.4.13 Compiling tower-http v0.3.4 error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:345 ~ tower[ab58]::balance::pool::{impl#3}::build) (CanonicalUserTypeAnnotation { user_ty: Canonical { max_universe: U0, variables: [CanonicalVarInfo { kind: Ty(General(U0)) }, CanonicalVarInfo { kind: Ty(General(U0)) }, CanonicalVarInfo { kind: Ty(General(U0)) }, CanonicalVarInfo { kind: Ty(General(U0)) }], value: TypeOf(DefId(0:232 ~ tower[ab58]::balance::p2c::service::{impl#1}::new), UserSubsts { substs: [^0, ^1], user_self_ty: Some(UserSelfTy { impl_def_id: DefId(0:229 ~ tower[ab58]::balance::p2c::service::{impl#1}), self_ty: balance::p2c::service::Balance<^2, ^3> }) }) }, span: /Users/goertler/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/tower-0.4.13/src/balance/pool/mod.rs:293:22: 293:34 (#0), inferred_ty: fn(std::pin::Pin>>) -> balance::p2c::service::Balance>>, Request> {balance::p2c::service::Balance::>>, Request>::new} }): bad user type AscribeUserType(fn(std::pin::Pin>>) -> balance::p2c::service::Balance>>, Request> {balance::p2c::service::Balance::>>, Request>::new}, DefId(0:232 ~ tower[ab58]::balance::p2c::service::{impl#1}::new) UserSubsts { substs: [_, _], user_self_ty: Some(UserSelfTy { impl_def_id: DefId(0:229 ~ tower[ab58]::balance::p2c::service::{impl#1}), self_ty: balance::p2c::service::Balance<_, _> }) }, type_of=fn(D) -> balance::p2c::service::Balance {balance::p2c::service::Balance::::new}): NoSolution | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_borrowck/src/type_check/mod.rs:1087:25 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1492:13 stack backtrace: note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.65.0-nightly (750bd1a7f 2022-09-14) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `tower` warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x109646552 - ::fmt::h4c5ecb0a45d5e886 1: 0x10969dcca - core::fmt::write::h1b48d1d1cb0b7961 2: 0x1096386dc - std::io::Write::write_fmt::hd88196c3a88e34fb 3: 0x10964943b - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::h0f6810d654ce88bd 4: 0x109649147 - std::panicking::default_hook::h99ae6a40b3c0b158 5: 0x1120bbcca - rustc_driver[a68fcf032531d799]::DEFAULT_HOOK::{closure#0}::{closure#0} 6: 0x109649b6e - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h6b1861a02d4bcbed 7: 0x116aa9a87 - std[67b2ec307cdf3306]::panicking::begin_panic::::{closure#0} 8: 0x116aa9219 - std[67b2ec307cdf3306]::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_end_short_backtrace::::{closure#0}, !> 9: 0x116e0ddf9 - std[67b2ec307cdf3306]::panicking::begin_panic:: 10: 0x116a9eaa9 - std[67b2ec307cdf3306]::panic::panic_any:: 11: 0x116aa354e - ::drop 12: 0x1120eb0ba - core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::ptr::drop_in_place:: 13: 0x1120f1afb - as core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::ops::drop::Drop>::drop 14: 0x1120d6db2 - core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::ptr::drop_in_place:: 15: 0x1120dbe9f - rustc_interface[fcdf76b1f16a6137]::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver[a68fcf032531d799]::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 16: 0x112133895 - >::set::, rustc_driver[a68fcf032531d799]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[503eaa35d8a7773]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 17: 0x1120f8ada - std[67b2ec307cdf3306]::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_begin_short_backtrace::, rustc_driver[a68fcf032531d799]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[503eaa35d8a7773]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}, core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[503eaa35d8a7773]::ErrorGuaranteed>> 18: 0x1120fc1f8 - <::spawn_unchecked_, rustc_driver[a68fcf032531d799]::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[503eaa35d8a7773]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}, core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::result::Result<(), rustc_errors[503eaa35d8a7773]::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#1} as core[cfcc7bd811e8a7b7]::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once::{shim:vtable#0} 19: 0x109652ad7 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::hf1224c03c7001e01 20: 0x7ff80bf854e1 - __pthread_start note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. ```
